title: 112_s1154
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Promises to Service-Disabled Veterans Act of 2011". It includes findings related to service-disabled veterans. Congress finds that federal agencies have an obligation to comply with the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999, which established a Government-wide goal of awarding at least 3 percent of contracts to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans each fiscal year. Progress in meeting the Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans has been slow, and prime contractors are obligated to contribute. The public has a right to know if Executive departments and contractors are meeting this goal. SEC. 3. TRANSPARENCY IN CONTRACTING GOALS FOR SMALL BUSINESS CONCERNS OWNED AND CONTROLLED BY SERVICE-DISABLED VETERANS. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. This includes definitions for covered contractors and Executive departments. Reports to the administrator are required three months after. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments must report the percentage of prime contracts awarded to these businesses quarterly. The Small Business Act requires executive departments to report on contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, including the percentage goal for subcontractor utilization. The Small Business Act mandates reporting on contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, including subcontractor utilization goals. This includes subcontractors of small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans, and the percentage of subcontracts awarded to them. The Small Business Act requires reporting on contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, including subcontractor utilization goals and the percentage of subcontracts awarded to them by covered contractors. The Small Business Act mandates reporting on contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, including subcontractor utilization goals and the percentage of subcontracts awarded to them by covered contractors. The Administrator ranks Executive departments based on these percentages annually. The Administrator ranks Executive departments annually based on the percentage of contracts awarded to small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. The Administrator annually ranks Executive departments based on contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans. The Administrator must publish this information on a public website for accessibility. The Administrator must publish a user-friendly, electronically searchable report on a website containing information submitted and rankings made regarding contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, with an exception for national security. The Administrator must publish a user-friendly, electronically searchable report on a website containing information submitted and rankings made regarding contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, with an exception for national security. The Administrator shall update the contents of the website not less frequently than quarterly and submit an annual progress report to Congress. The Administrator must submit an annual report to Congress on the progress of Executive departments towards meeting Government-wide contracting goals. The report should include whether the website contains the latest data reported by the departments. The annual report to Congress includes the latest data from Executive departments and a recommendation for a prime contractor recognized for progress in contracting with small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans.
